eventName: Such is the Joy of Our Reunion
storyInfo: Leizi returns to the Judicial Review Office for the trial of Yu Cheng, a former deputy minister of the Office. Yu Cheng has turned himself in, claiming to be the one who burned down the archives in the scrollery. Yu Cheng's strange behavior leads Leizi to believe he may have an ulterior motive. Leizi decides to review old cases that Yu Cheng once investigated.

attributes.content: What do you want to show me?
attributes.name: Young-sounding Voice

attributes.content: Pick up the pace a little, we'll be there soon.
attributes.name: Resolute Voice

attributes.content: If you walk in the snow by the stream, the fragrant plum blossoms are rare. However, you can find some at the base of the mountain.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I suppose the view of the fireworks against the city skyline from atop the mountain could be the only thing worth climbing all the way up here.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Fireworks? Who cares about those?! I brought you here to see... this pine tree.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: An evergreen... It can withstand the cold weather.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: No. That's not what's special about it.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I planted this tree myself, right before I assumed my post in Baizao. Back then, I had the same mindset as you.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: After all these years, I'm a different person now, and this tree is a different tree.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I do not understand.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: That doesn't matter. All you need to do now is look at the tree; imprint it in your memory.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Qingyan, you will do well in the Judicial Review Office. You will go on to be an excellent Deputy Minister or maybe a minister yourself!
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Those cases will not be a problem for you. There's really only one issue that you'll need to focus on—
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Will you be able to handle the truth?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: I do not understand.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You don't need to understand now. Every once in a while, you will think back to this pine tree. Once you've spent enough time contemplating the tree, you will understand the rest.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: After I die, cut down the tree. Use its wood to fashion my coffin.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Mr. Yu...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: We should be going. The higher you climb, the colder it gets.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.text: Years of wind and snow, moments fleeting like blossoms in the morning and evening light.
Once more, I think back to the pine tree and the mountain path, buried in snow.
Yu Cheng, what penalty do you propose to atone for your guilt?

attributes.content: (snoring softly)
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Huh? What time is it? Has the suspect confessed yet?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Censor Jie Zhen, this is a serious matter. Please mind your words and behavior.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: This is a routine internal matter for the Judicial Review Office. The Department of Discipline and Supervision is just going through the motions. It's not a big deal.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: However, this trial today certainly has been interesting. The minister is usually quite well-tempered. I've never seen her that angry before.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Yu Cheng, you served in the Judicial Review Office once. You took an oath before the bronze mirror.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Do you really think the Judicial Review Office is the proper place for you to act like a spoiled brat?!
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: That's an unjust accusation. You asked me all that you needed to ask, and I answered them. What else would you have me do?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: On the fifteenth of last month, around 1:45 AM, someone set fire to the southern end of the Judicial Review Office scrollery. That person was me.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Liar! When the fire broke out, you were in pre-trial detention. How could you have started it?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: If you planned the fire, you had help. Name your co-conspirator.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I had no co-conspirator. However, I did have a helper.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: A fowlbeast.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: That night, a wounded fowlbeast landed by the window of my cell. I fed it a few grains of rice and some fresh water.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: The fowlbeast was quite intelligent. I saved it, and it was willing to return the favor. I gave it a burning straw and told it to fly to the scrollery.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Whaa???
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Yu Cheng, the courtroom has no time for your games!
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I'm not playing games. Ask me anything, and I will answer truthfully.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Very well. You say you started the fire. Elaborate on that, if you will.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: What species of fowlbeast was it that you used?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Do I look like a fowlbeast expert? I only remember that it was completely black, without a single stray hair... as black as the human heart.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: You said you gave the fowlbeast a burning straw. You were locked in a cell. Where did you get the straw?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I picked it out of my sleeping cushion.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Your cushion was made of cotton.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Then my memory is mistaken. It must have fallen in from the fowlbeast's nest.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: The guards did a full search of your cell after the fire. They did not find any fowlbeast nest.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: If criminals didn't try to cover their tracks, we wouldn't need the Judicial Review Office or the Ministry of Justice, would we?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: That fowlbeast truly understood human nature.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Why you...
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Oh, right, as for how I lit the straw in the first place—I struck the cell bars with these iron shackles exactly eight hundred sixty-three times, one for each year of the Judicial Review Office's existence.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: That is as much detail as I can provide on the fire. Will it do?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Madam Minister, do you have more questions for me?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: It seems that he has been reading some fanciful stories since his retirement.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: This is no time for jokes.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Well, she had the patience to play along with him and indulge his insanity.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Do you want to enter this line into the record?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: ...Of course.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Interesting...
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Yu Cheng was once appointed Deputy Minister for the Judicial Review Office's Haoran Pavilion. There, he took down countless corrupt mandarins and notorious criminals.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: However, after his retirement, you convicted him of fabricating evidence, which is how he ended up here.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: As you think back now, do you regret your choice, Deputy Minister Lin?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The law is the law. It bends for no man. Stop trying to stir up trouble, Censor Jie.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But when we look at it, Yu Cheng's behavior is quite odd. When he was charged with fabricating evidence, he did not question it or protest. Now, after he's been convicted, he decides to start a fire?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: That's not right...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I still have questions!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Yes, Deputy Minister Lin?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: ...Hmph.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan puts down her pen and paper and happens to meet Yu Cheng's gaze. The prisoner, who has been pretending to be insane, is now staring at her intently.
She wants to know the truth. She does not fear revealing herself in the process.
Yu Cheng seems pleased with Lin Qingyan's reaction. He closes his eyes, as an ugly grin crosses his face.
Deputy Minister Lin, as acting clerk, you need only take notes.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Minister Chen, there is one question you haven't yet asked. Yu Cheng claims he set the fire. What was his motive?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: The suspect's confession is clearly nonsense. Why bother asking his motive?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Hahaha. I am the one who set fire to the scrollery. You must believe me.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: As for why I did it...
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Yu Cheng!
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: There were seventy-four thousand case files in the southern section of the scrollery, the result of sixty years of painstaking effort and the hard work of twenty-four deputy ministers—and you saw fit to turn it all to ash?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Yu Cheng suddenly droops his head. He remains silent for what seems like ages. The Minister's eyes remain fixed on him, watching his every move.
As I see it, it was no great loss.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Those files were filled with half-truths, whitewashed fabrications, and outright lies. Gazing upon them dirties the eyes; thinking of them taints the mind.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: So I thought it best to cleanse it all in flames.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Cleanse?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Just what are you trying to say?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: What am I trying to say? If you keen to know, then let's have a discussion: that which I burned, was it clean, or dirty?
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Minister Chen, The suspect is clearly suffering from some sort of mental disease. It's getting late. Shall we conclude the questioning for today?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Escort Yu Cheng back to his cell.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I truly regret that we subjected the Department of Discipline and Supervision to this circus here today.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: It is truly a vexing case. We understand.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The Judicial Review Office will be sure to submit a full explanation to the Department of Discipline and Supervision.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Sigh... I just hope this can be resolved quickly, so I don't have to make so many trips here. You've planted way too many camphor trees in this courtyard—they're making me sneeze.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I shall take my leave now, Deputy Minister Lin. See you.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: You should be off too, Lin Qingyan.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: The courtroom door swings open, as sunlight pours in once more. Lin Qingyan immediately spots the seven towers with eighteen-pointed roofs hidden in the shadows of the trees.
The Judicial Review Office scrollery were all built in this style. The roofs of the towers seem to be covered with ash, the remnants of the burned southern section.
Just as she is about to step out the door, she hears a faint voice.
Lin Qingyan, it's almost time.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Do not forget.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan steps out into the cold sunlight without even hesitating.
Achoo!
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Censor Jie Zhen, you're still here?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I was waiting to chat with you for a minute. It's not convenient to talk in there.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: If you still want save... I mean... investigate Yu Cheng's case, you'd better move quickly.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: After the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies is over, all prisoners detained in Baizao will either be transferred to another prison or exiled. In any case, the cells must be emptied within two weeks.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Two weeks...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: The imperial decree should reach you shortly. I just spotted it early, so I'm giving you a heads-up.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: And here I thought you didn't care much for these things.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: It is within my power to avoid caring, but you cannot get it out of your head. Yu Cheng is very important to you, isn't he?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: He was kind of like my teacher in the Judicial Review Office. He's the one who taught me to distinguish right from wrong.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: When I first discovered that he had fabricated evidence to convict a corrupt mandarin... well, I shrugged it off as 'using any means necessary to achieve justice.'
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: However, I never imagined he would set fire to the scrollery. There's absolutely no justice in that.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Indeed... I can't figure him out.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: But it does provoke a question... They've never emptied the jails for the Feast before. Why do it this year?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: This matter may not concern you directly, but I'm sure you've heard something about it?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Yumen experienced a Catastrophe at the beginning of the year. Then, this summer, we suffered the Dahuang incident.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: And what was the root cause of all this?
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: ...The bestial Sui.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: This thousand-year-old case must finally be resolved...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I dare not engage in presumptuous speculation. This is as much as I can say for now.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: Duoxie...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Censor Jie Zhen... why did you terminate the ongoing interrogation?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Ah...
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: As the saying goes, 'Words may deceive, so trust your eyes.'
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I wager you haven't seen the burned scrollery yet.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: No, I have not.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Perhaps you'd better go see for yourself.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: I will take my leave.
attributes.name: Jie Zhen

attributes.content: The restaurant, which was loud and boisterous just a moment ago, goes completely silent.
The regulars, anticipating what is to come, file out of the diner one-by-one. Of course, they remember to leave money for their meals.
Jiang, close the door.
attributes.name: Irritable Youth

attributes.content: ...*sigh*
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: What? What happened?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Jiang, wasn't she just eating these tangerine cakes here?
attributes.name: Irritable Youth

attributes.content: Yes, she was.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: And didn't you tell me she was criticizing the taste?
attributes.name: Irritable Youth

attributes.content: No. She said they taste 'different', not bad, just 'different'.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: (winking vigorously)
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I guess you'd call it criticism. They're not exactly orthodox, different to what I had before.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: So you're the head chef, eh? Pretty young, aren't you?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Don't try to change the subject!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I was just critiquing the food. That's not a capital offense!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Besides, I thought the rest of the dishes were awesome.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Now you're on to flattery! This is my restaurant, and I have my rules! You either tell me what's wrong with the tangerine cakes, or I won't let you leave!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I told you already. They taste different to the ones I've had before.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Where, and when, did you eat them before?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Oh maybe... more than ten years ago? When I was living in Victoria, a relative sent them to me.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Did you come here to stir up trouble? Jiang! Escort her out!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: No. We're not in the habit of kicking customers out of the restaurant...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Good madam, think for a minute. What exactly is it about these cakes that tastes different? Maybe this is all some kind of misunderstanding?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Let me think... I remember the tangerine cakes I had before were sweeter. Yes, you must not have used enough sugar.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The tangerine cakes need more sugar? Hahaha...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: To think I took you for a food critic. You are a woman with absolutely no taste. I won't waste my time arguing with you. Please leave.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You say I have no taste, when the real problem is your cooking?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Oh... no...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: My cooking, you say?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Don't make me laugh! My cooking... my culinary talent, my—
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Alright then. I'll make you a bet. Go out this door here and sample the food at some of the other restaurants. If you find a better tasting meal, I'll give you this entire shop!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: (softly) No, please no.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: But if you can't find better food, you have to sit at this table by the window and shout out to the streets...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Shout what?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Apologize to me! One hundred times!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: But what would I want with your restaurant?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Let's do this instead. If I find food that tastes better, then you'll let me eat here for a month, free, and you'll teach me how to cook a few of the tastiest dishes in Yanese cuisine, also free of charge.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: There's an old Yanese saying, 'Give a man a fin and you'll feed him for a day. Teach a man to fincatch, and you'll feed him for a lifetime.'
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: This restaurant... when I leave, I can't take it with me. If you teach me how to cook a few tasty dishes, I can cook them for my friends.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: But weren't you just criticizing my cooking?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I told you, all your other dishes taste great.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Wait. Wait a moment! Don't think you can just trick me like that! We still need to discuss the tangerine cakes!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Okay. Then I'll take your bet. I know I can find tangerine cakes, somewhere in Baizao, that taste like the ones I had before.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Huh? What's that weird smell?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I think it's coming from back in the kitchen...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I know that smell. It's like something is overcooked.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: My stew!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Dear customer, I apologize. Our head chef has a bad temper and is easily offended.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Please come again, alright?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Pretty weird...
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I've heard that skilled chefs tend to be eccentric.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: In fact, I'll bet the reason he was able to become a good chef was precisely because he takes his food so seriously.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Did you notice that each of the five tofu dishes you ordered had tofu cut in a different way, yet every piece of tofu within each dish was exactly the same size and shape?
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: I don't think many chefs in Baizao could accomplish that.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Hm? You overheard our argument?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Sorry, I wasn't eavesdropping. You were just within earshot.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: You were all having such fun, sharing your dishes amongst yourselves. Well, I believe you accidentally took the plate of tangerine cakes that I ordered.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Oh! Sorry about that!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: What a dummy I was, taking someone else's food and then having a fight with the chef over it.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: You wait here. I'll order you some more, straight away!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No. There's no need for that.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: I came here today to try the food. After seeing how much you all enjoyed it, well, I figure it must be good enough.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: However, I'm still a little curious, what exactly did you not like about the tangerine cakes?
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: I can't really put my finger on it, but I just know I've eaten better ones before.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Are you sure the dish you ate before was indeed 'tangerine cakes'?
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Of course!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: One of my relatives lived in Baizao, and would ship me these cakes. There's no way I'd be wrong... I'm sure.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: May I trouble you with a request, then?
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: You're going out looking for another restaurant that serves these tangerine cakes, right? Can you take me with you?
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Sure! You're from Baizao, aren't you? That's perfect. You know your way around these parts!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Then again, it's getting kind of late. Let's meet here again tomorrow at noon. What do you say?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Certainly.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: Oh, right. By the way, my name is Blaze. I'm a tourist from Victoria. How should I call you?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I am a woman of few hobbies. I like to write, and I like to eat.
attributes.name: Elegant Woman

attributes.content: My pen name is 'The Wandering Foodie'. In any case, you may call me Xingzhu for short.
attributes.name: Xingzhu

attributes.content: Such a trove of knowledge, those wonderful archives...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Ashes to ashes... dust to dust...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: The dark space still has a lingering, acrid smell. On the collapsed beams of ironwood, murky raindrops tremble, ready to fall.
The iron chests that once held so many records and books have been warped and twisted by the flames. The paper and ink within have smoldered into ash, leaving only faint traces of words.
Do not linger too long. Rain showers after a fire send smoke up into the air.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: What have we learned so far?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: We've determined this to be arson.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: The absurd part? The fire's time and location match Yu Cheng's confession perfectly.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: The scrollery was heavily guarded, yet on the night of the fire, the guards didn't notice anything.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Not only was the perpetrator highly skilled in kung fu, but they also had intimate knowledge of the Judicial Review Office's layout. They must have been working with Yu Cheng for quite some time.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You're saying... you think this was an inside job?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: We cannot be certain.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: How bad was the damage?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: All records that were burned were from old cases, which has little effect on our current work. However, if these cases were ever to be reviewed in the future, there would be no evidence to go on.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Nearly all of these cases were Yu Cheng's responsibility.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Do you really believe Yu Cheng was the one who burned the scrollery?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Absolutely not...
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: No matter what nonsense he spouts, he was imprisoned when the fire broke out. There's no way he could have done it himself.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: However, I'm sure he's involved in some way. He's working with someone else.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: What did he mean when he suggested the files are 'dirty'?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Is there something on your mind?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Do you still remember... the last case Yu Cheng investigated before he retired?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: How could I forget?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Forty years ago, the Minister of Justice was stabbed in the street. The assassin turned out to be a mad beggar.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: The Judicial Review Office did everything in their power to uncover the man's identity, to no avail.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: In the end, they classified the murder as a random, spur-of-the moment act of violence.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: But nearly thirty years later, Yu Cheng accused the sitting Minister of Rites, Ning Shu, of being the murderer.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I worked with Yu Cheng for many, many years. I knew him better than anyone.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: However, in his last few years at the Office, he began to change.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Something radicalized him. He began doing 'whatever it takes' to catch criminals. He even started fabricating evidence to close cold cases and settle old scores.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: If the accusations against him were baseless, then why did Minister Ning resign?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What do you mean?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Do you still remember... Gu Quan?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: It all began when Gu Quan, serving as the envoy of ceremonial rites, died en route to Victoria...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Yu Cheng believed that Minister Ning murdered the Minister of Justice, and then killed the important witness in the case thirty years later.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But that's the absurdity... the envoy had only just taken office. How could he have been connected to a case from thirty years prior?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Moreover, the envoy's manner, place, and time of death were all clearly established: he drowned near the Victorian border. How could the Minister of Rites have orchestrated his death, all the way from Baizao?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: The Judicial Review Office recorded Gu Quan's death in the case files...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: The files are somewhere in this pile of ash that lays before you...
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Why raise these two cases now? Do you think they are connected to the fire somehow?
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I would call it a hunch...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Yu Cheng's confession has drawn our attention, but clearly, there's some kind of larger scheme behind the fire. The real question isn't who set the fire, but the arsonist's ultimate goal.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Would you hand this case over to me?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: On what grounds?!
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Yu Cheng asked you to take notes during his trial. This is why you stand here now, and it is also the reason I cannot allow you to participate any further.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Whatever Yu Cheng's plan, you are most certainly a part of it.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: I know you regard him as a mentor and couldn't bear to see his reputation tarnished, but I will assign someone else to investigate the fire. Rest assured, we will get to the bottom of this.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: What about the cases that Yu Cheng once investigated?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: You'd best forget about those.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: No matter what you intend to investigate, it's simply not a good time.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Why do you say that?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan, you are a Deputy Minister in the Judicial Review Office, not some patrolwoman. Every case you handle has a ripple effect.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Your so-called 'act of justice' may very well become a dagger in the hands of those with ulterior motives.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: So you know what's really going on with these cases, don't you?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Stay away from Yu Cheng's cases. That is my suggestion. Do not force me to make it an order.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: Oh, and I have one final piece of advice...
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: You must learn to prioritize. The past is never as important as the present.
attributes.name: Chen Che

attributes.content: The young Deputy Minister is still standing in the same spot.
She walks down the path that's been cleared through the rubble, through the place that once held so many case files.
The arsonist's motive is quite clear: he never wanted those files to see the light of day.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Whether Yu Cheng fabricated evidence or not, all available clues in both cases point to Ning Shu.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But why would the Minister of Rites assassinate another high-ranking mandarin?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: She bends down and brushes aside a charred beam, revealing a hint of green emerging from the ashes.
It's a pine tree.
Yu Cheng, you...
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I planted this tree myself, right before I assumed my post in Baizao.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: After I die, cut down the tree. Use its wood to fashion my coffin.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan, it's almost time.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: Do not forget.
attributes.name: Yu Cheng

attributes.content: This month's water bill is two thousand, and electricity is two thousand five hundred, while ingredient costs...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Go do your accounting somewhere else please. I can't stand you buzzing in my ear.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: According to my calculations, if you can come up with another three thousand, we'll be able to keep the doors open past this month.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: And where am I going to dig out that coin?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: There are ways to do it—like the two months of meals owed by Wang the carpenter, or you can visit Shopkeeper Liu across the street and ask him for the balance he owes for last month's funeral banquet.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Collect enough of those outstanding debts, and we'll have what we need to make it through the month.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: That's... less than ideal... isn't it?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Customers on credit are in a tough spot. Going up to them and calling in the debt right now... feels awkward, to say the least.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You want to play the good guy? Why, every time the rent collector comes calling, do you ask me to deal with him?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: You're... big-boned. Even if the rent-collector is angry, he won't take you in a fight.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Maybe... there's another way...
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Ding Feng Lou is coming here again today to hand out invitations to the competition.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: They're hiring chefs in preparation for the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies. If you can manage to win the competition, the prize money alone will be enough to pay our rent through the end of the year!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: No! No way, no how!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: I am the proud owner and head chef of 'Savors at Yu's'! How could I stoop so low as to work for someone else?
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: This is no ordinary cook! The head chef of Ding Feng Lou doesn't take apprentices, but even a casual demonstration provides enough to keep most chefs learning for three to five years. Plenty of people dream of working under him, never to get the chance!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Besides, it's for the Feast of a Hundred Delicacies! The menu is recorded every year and passed down through generations. This is the lifelong dream of countless chefs—
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Those who want to attend are free to go. I shall not.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Are you scared?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I'm not scared! You're scared!
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Hmmph. What Feast of a Hundred Delicacies? It's nothing more than a group of old gray-hairs hosting a big dinner party.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: All they ever talk is politics. They don't even have a chance to eat. It's a waste of time.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Just listen to your arrogance. You talk as if you've been there in person.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: I've catered so many banquets. They're all the same.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: You won't take any of my suggestions! I guess we're just going to let this restaurant fail then!
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Good grief, with a boss like you, I've got to start making new career plans.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: Okay, okay. If it's just another three thousand we need, I'll start making extra deliveries each day through the end of the month.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: Have you no ambition? As a chef, don't you want your restaurant to do well? I'm not even sure why you opened it in the first place.
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: People need to eat, which means there has to be someone to cook for them. As long as we have customers who want to eat my food, this restaurant will do just fine.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: More importantly, I promised I'd wait for a certain customer, and that one still haven't shown. I can't close the shop yet.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: What customer? Who do you need to wait for?
attributes.name: Jiang

attributes.content: It's just not time yet. A great stew demands patience. You have to add in the ingredients at just the right time.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: There's no need to rush.
attributes.name: Young Chef

attributes.content: What's with this thing? I can't get any channels. I want to watch the news!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Hey. You're back.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What have you learned?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I brought some food for you. I found a new restaurant today. The kitchen stinks to high heaven, but the cooking is pretty solid.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Oh, right, there's one other thing. Today I found these snacks that my dad once sent me a long time ago.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Who gave you permission to leave you room as you please?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Wha?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Seriously? I've been living off takeout for three days straight. I just wanted to go out and grab a bite to eat—is that not allowed?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: How many times have I told you? Your identity and status are extremely important; your current situation is dreadfully tenuous. Are you taking this seriously or not?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Lin Qingyan! Are you off your rocker? We already established the three rules. No one said I was confined to my room!
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I had a good life back at Rhodes Island. Then you showed up and told me my father's death was suspicious, without giving any details.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I came all the way here to Baizao, the place where my dad used to live, and you still haven't told me anything! You've made me stay in this room, day after day, and now you have the gall to yell at me?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I... that is—
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Forgive me. I should not have scolded you. The current situation is not as I had anticipated.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: What 'situation'? Is there anything I can do to help?
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I don't know. A lot of unexpected things happened in Baizao before we arrived.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: If you would aid me, then simply do what you can to avoid danger, understood?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: As for your father, I just happened to be handed that case a few years ago.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: The case was originally being handled by my predecessor, someone I trusted deeply. Your father seemed to have been spending a lot of time pursuing a certain 'truth' in the last few years of his life.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: His death was suspicious. Every clue we've found hints that there were larger forces at work there. How large? We don't know for certain, nor can we even hope to guess.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But your mere existence is the most important piece of evidence we have.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Blaze, I vow to you I will find the truth, and once I do, I will tell you everything.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: However, until I do, I simply need you to trust me. I need you to cooperate with me.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: By the way, what were you saying about your father just now?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: I said I found these snacks that he used to send to me a long time ago.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: They don't taste the same as they used to. Maybe it's just because I'm remembering wrong.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: The Yanese have a saying for this, right? 'The situation remains the same, yet the people have changed.'
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: No. That's not right. The situation has also changed.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Well then, a more apt saying would be, 'Times change, and with them, change all things.'
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Too much time has passed. It will be very hard for us to find any clues left from back then.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: But these are in fact one of the few things I've found in Baizao that relates to my father.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: When I lived with my mother in Victoria, my dad would send them to me from time to time.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I figured that by the time I got my disease under control and figured out what I really believed in, my dad would be back in Victoria, waiting for me to come home. Naive.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Everyone longs for that sort of 'happy ending'.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: And yet, by the time I found a place that could treat my Oripathy and finished some of the things I had to do with the bunny's crew... my dad... was gone.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: Before you came and found me, I always thought my dad's death was an accident. I was sad, but there was nothing I could do about it.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: But if you're telling me my father was murdered.... then that's an entirely different story.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: I need to learn the truth. I owe that to my father... and myself.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: In all truth, I know very little about what happened to your father. Many of the old archives have been lost, and very little information can be extracted from what remains.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Just from looking at the case files he left behind, we can see that your father worked as a ceremonial officer in the Ministry of Rites for over ten years but never got promoted. It seems he was not well-suited to serve in public office.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: However, to stay in a position like that for over a decade... he must have been a good person.
attributes.name: Lin Qingyan

attributes.content: Good people... good people also die.
attributes.name: Blaze

attributes.content: She walks over to the window, closes her eyes, and rubs her temples.
The faraway city lights are shimmering in the twilight. The years of wandering are long over.
People today are moving from one stage of life to the next, as the city guides them and runs right behind them.
Many boundaries are blurred, many high walls become thoroughfares, many hurried footsteps pass over the paving stones. Not everyone is qualified to etch their name into the annals of history.
